00025 #include <stdio.h>
00026 #include <stdlib.h>
00027 #include <stdarg.h>
00028 #include "midas.h"
00029 
00030 static int debug_flag = 0;
00031 
00032 typedef struct {
00033    char device[NAME_LENGTH];
00034 } NULL_SETTINGS;
00035 
00036 #define NULL_SETTINGS_STR "\
00037 Device = STRING : [32] com1\n\
00038 "
00039 
00040 typedef struct {
00041    NULL_SETTINGS settings;
00042    int fd;                      /* device handle for NULL device */
00043 } NULL_INFO;
00044 
00045 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00046 
00047 int null_open(char *device)
00048 {
00049    int fd;
00050 
00051    /* open device using device name, like
00052 
00053       fd = open(device);
00054       if (fd == -1)
00055       return -1;
00056 
00057     */
00058 
00059    /* simulate open */
00060    fd = 1;
00061 
00062    return fd;
00063 }
00064 
00065 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00066 
00067 INT null_exit(NULL_INFO * info)
00068 {
00069    /* something like
00070 
00071       close(info->fd);
00072 
00073     */
00074 
00075    return SUCCESS;
00076 }
00077 
00078 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00079 
00080 int null_write(NULL_INFO * info, char *data, int size)
00081 {
00082    DWORD written, i;
00083 
00084    if (debug_flag) {
00085       FILE *f;
00086 
00087       f = fopen("null.log", "a");
00088       fprintf(f, "write: ");
00089       for (i = 0; (int) i < size; i++)
00090          fprintf(f, "%X ", data[i]);
00091       fprintf(f, "\n");
00092       fclose(f);
00093    }
00094 
00095    /* something like
00096       write(info->fd, data, size, &written);
00097 
00098     */
00099 
00100    /* simulate writing */
00101    written = size;
00102 
00103    return written;
00104 }
00105 
00106 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00107 
00108 int null_read(NULL_INFO * info, char *data, int size, int timeout)
00109 {
00110    int i, l;
00111 
00112    /* somethng like
00113 
00114       memset(data, 0, size);
00115       for (l=0 ; l<size ; l++)
00116       {
00117       status = read(info->fd, data+l, 1, &i);
00118       if (!status || i == 0)
00119       break;
00120       }
00121     */
00122 
00123    /* simulate reading */
00124    ss_sleep(10);
00125    l = 0;
00126 
00127    if (debug_flag && l > 0) {
00128       FILE *f;
00129 
00130       f = fopen("null.log", "a");
00131       fprintf(f, "read: ");
00132       for (i = 0; i < l; i++)
00133          fprintf(f, "%X ", data[i]);
00134       fprintf(f, "\n");
00135       fclose(f);
00136    }
00137 
00138    return l;
00139 }
00140 
00141 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00142 
00143 int null_puts(NULL_INFO * info, char *str)
00144 {
00145    DWORD written;
00146 
00147    if (debug_flag) {
00148       FILE *f;
00149 
00150       f = fopen("null.log", "a");
00151       fprintf(f, "puts: %s\n", str);
00152       fclose(f);
00153    }
00154 
00155    /* something like
00156       write(info->fd, str, strlen(str), &written);
00157 
00158     */
00159 
00160    /* simulate writing */
00161    written = strlen(str);
00162 
00163    return written;
00164 }
00165 
00166 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00167 
00168 int null_gets(NULL_INFO * info, char *str, int size, char *pattern, int timeout)
00169 {
00170    int l;
00171 
00172    /* something like 
00173 
00174       memset(str, 0, size);
00175       for (l=0 ; l<size-1 ; l++)
00176       {
00177       status = read(info->fd, str+l, 1, &i);
00178       if (!status || i == 0)
00179       {
00180       if (pattern && pattern[0])
00181       return 0;
00182       break;
00183       }
00184 
00185       if (pattern && pattern[0])
00186       if (strstr(str, pattern) != NULL)
00187       break;
00188       }
00189     */
00190 
00191    /* simulate reading */
00192    ss_sleep(10);
00193    l = 0;
00194    str[0] = 0;
00195 
00196    if (debug_flag && l > 0) {
00197       FILE *f;
00198 
00199       f = fopen("null.log", "a");
00200       fprintf(f, "gets %s: %s\n", pattern, str);
00201       fclose(f);
00202    }
00203 
00204    return l;
00205 }

00207 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00208 
00209 int null_init(HNDLE hkey, void **pinfo)
00210 {
00211    HNDLE hDB, hkeybd;
00212    INT size, status;
00213    NULL_INFO *info;
00214 
00215    /* allocate info structure */
00216    info = calloc(1, sizeof(NULL_INFO));
00217    *pinfo = info;
00218 
00219    cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, NULL);
00220 
00221    /* create NULL settings record */
00222    status = db_create_record(hDB, hkey, "BD", NULL_SETTINGS_STR);
00223    if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
00224       return FE_ERR_ODB;
00225 
00226    db_find_key(hDB, hkey, "BD", &hkeybd);
00227    size = sizeof(info->settings);
00228    db_get_record(hDB, hkeybd, &info->settings, &size, 0);
00229 
00230    /* open port */
00231    info->fd = null_open(info->settings.device);
00232 
00233    if (info->fd < 0)
00234       return FE_ERR_HW;
00235 
00236    return SUCCESS;
00237 }
00238 
00239 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00240 
00241 INT null(INT cmd, ...)
00242 {
00243    va_list argptr;
00244    HNDLE hkey;
00245    INT status, size, timeout;
00246    void *info;
00247    char *str, *pattern;
00248 
00249    va_start(argptr, cmd);
00250    status = FE_SUCCESS;
00251 
00252    switch (cmd) {
00253    case CMD_INIT:
00254       hkey = va_arg(argptr, HNDLE);
00255       info = va_arg(argptr, void *);
00256       status = null_init(hkey, info);
00257       break;
00258 
00259    case CMD_EXIT:
00260       info = va_arg(argptr, void *);
00261       status = null_exit(info);
00262       break;
00263 
00264    case CMD_NAME:
00265       info = va_arg(argptr, void *);
00266       str = va_arg(argptr, char *);
00267       strcpy(str, "null");
00268       break;
00269 
00270    case CMD_WRITE:
00271       info = va_arg(argptr, void *);
00272       str = va_arg(argptr, char *);
00273       size = va_arg(argptr, int);
00274       status = null_write(info, str, size);
00275       break;
00276 
00277    case CMD_READ:
00278       info = va_arg(argptr, void *);
00279       str = va_arg(argptr, char *);
00280       size = va_arg(argptr, INT);
00281       timeout = va_arg(argptr, INT);
00282       status = null_read(info, str, size, timeout);
00283       break;
00284 
00285    case CMD_PUTS:
00286       info = va_arg(argptr, void *);
00287       str = va_arg(argptr, char *);
00288       status = null_puts(info, str);
00289       break;
00290 
00291    case CMD_GETS:
00292       info = va_arg(argptr, void *);
00293       str = va_arg(argptr, char *);
00294       size = va_arg(argptr, INT);
00295       pattern = va_arg(argptr, char *);
00296       timeout = va_arg(argptr, INT);
00297       status = null_gets(info, str, size, pattern, timeout);
00298       break;
00299 
00300    case CMD_DEBUG:
00301       status = va_arg(argptr, INT);
00302       debug_flag = status;
00303       break;
00304    }
00305 
00306    va_end(argptr);
00307 
00308    return status;
00309 }
